1.text: Bel bent; Nebo bowed down; their images were for the beast and for the cattle: your gifts were carried; a lifting up to the weary.

2.text: They bowed down, they bent together; they were not able to deliver the burden and their soul went into captivity.

3.text: Hear to me, ye house of Jacob, and all the remnant of the house of Israel, being carried from the belly, being lifted up from the womb:

4.text: find even to old age I am he; and even to grayness I will bear; I made and I will lift up, and I will bear, and I will deliver.

5.text: To whom will ye liken me and make equal? and compare me and we shall be like?

6.text: Squandering gold out of the bag and they will weigh silver in the balance, they will hire a founder, and he will make it a god: they will fall down, they will also worship.

7.text: They will lift him up upon the shoulder, they will carry him, they will set him down in his place and he will stand; from his place he shall not depart: also he will cry out to him and he will not answer; he will not save him from his straits.

8.text: Remember this, shew yourselves men: turn back, ye transgressing, upon the heart.

9.text: Remember the former things from forever: for I am God and no god besides, and none like me.

10.text: Announcing the last part from the beginning, and from of old what was not done, saying, My counsel shall stand, and I will do all my delight:

11.text: Calling a ravenous beast from the sunrising, from a land afar off a man of my counsel: also I spake, also I will bring it; I formed, also I will do it.

12.text: Hear to me, ye strong of heart, being far from justice.

13.text: I brought near my justice; it shall not be far off, and my salvation shall not delay: and I gave salvation in Zion for Israel my beauty.
